data.title: My introduction to politics was local Atlanta politics, so since the age of 4 I’ve only ever seen a Black Mayor, City Council Member,...
data.meta_description:
1,927 likes, 378 comments - isaachayes3 on July 15, 2024: "My introduction to politics was local Atlanta politics, so since the age of 4 I’ve only ever seen a Black Mayor, City Council Member, Superintendent, and Community Leaders that were almost exclusively Democrats. 

So I have a very positive perspective of Democrats cause I saw what happens when civil rights leaders infiltrated city government and changed laws specifically on behalf of the economic advancement of BLACK PEOPLE. 

Atlanta isn’t an anomaly. It was a deliberately constructed and successful Black political and economic ecosystem achieved through the Democratic process of voting for Democrats. 

I say this to say that “The Democrats” are who WE elect into power. Not a group of people that we assume have our best interests in mind. We choose who we want in power. 

So I fully understand the lack of faith in both parties depending on where you live. 

But I can unequivocally that Democrat policies and agendas have been more aligned with the Black community than the other party. 

So it’s not the Democratic Party you have issue with it’s the power you have to implement your agenda in the party. 

And that I can say is heavily dependent on where you live and your population numbers. 

I think all black communities around America should examine the Democratic Party of Atlanta, Georgia, and the civil rights leaders that took power and gave it to the people.".
